repnme.cdata!:
Djibouti - Manpower and Education
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Manpower and Education Development
            Project in Djibouti. The Manpower and Education Development
            Project had four objectives: (a) To improve the coordination
            of vocational training with labor market patterns; (b) To
            increase access to primary education; (c) To upgrade the
            relevance and quality of education at the primary and lower
            secondary levels; and (d) To improve the management capacity
            of the Ministry of National Education (MEN) while reducing
            costs and better allocating resources. Overall project
            outcome was partially satisfactory. With the exception of
            the vocational training component, the Bank's
            performance during the identification and preparation phase
            was generally satisfactory. Overall, the Borrower's
            performance was satisfactory during project preparation. The
            Borrower, however, could have been more realistic and
            functional in its approach to improving the coordination of
            vocational training. Lessons learned from the project are:
            (a) Planning, coordination and monitoring mechanisms should
            be well developed priorto project-start up; (b) Sequencing
            core training and project execution is essential for
            capacity building and successful project implementation; (c)
            Institutional strengthening occurs only with strong
            government commitment and firm political decision making;
            (d) Stakeholder participation in decision-making is
            essential for fostering ownership of project activities and
            outcomes; and (e) Allocation of Bank resources for
            supervision should consider project scope and complexity.
